Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1

rfc2616 says about a POST:

   If a resource has been created on the origin server, the response
   SHOULD be 201 (Created) and contain an entity which describes the
   status of the request and refers to the new resource, and a Location
   header (see section 14.30).

If the POST creates a resource at a single URL is it ok to just return the
Location: header w/o any body content?

Also, can someone provide examples what the body typically might contain?  I
see comments about "a list of locations" but no specific examples.

(I'm returning body responses serialized as json).

Thanks,

-- 
Bill Moseley
moseley@...

--000e0cd13bd410f27b048268e54c
Content-Type: text/html; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
